website_summaries.verdict: These affordably priced forearm crutches won't replace higher-end bariatric models for long-term use, but they're a good alternative to traditional armpit crutches. Sizing and customizing are important considerations.
pros: Telescoping arms make these easy to transport
cons: Some complaints of only receiving one crutch
Some complaints that the feet wore down too quickly

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturing 2nd sold as a first.
customer_reviews.text: two units to the set. One of the units had a serious manufacturing flaw that was sent out into the public. Seller continued the flaw by reselling the unit after it had been sold once and returned. Flaw is that the holes in the main segment were drilled at the wrong angle forcing the cuff at an angle from the hand grip. It is not a flaw that can be repaired by the consumer without special tools or equiment in order to straighten the angle
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I've never used forearm crutches before. I have a condition that makes balance extremely difficult and causes joint issues. I've used a walker and cane but these were.... A game changer. I was skipping around the living room because I didn't feel so hindered and it felt natural, like walking! Only note: the arm bands are not adjustable and are too big for my arms. But even so, they're wonderful. I can't afford the extremely expensive kind and these were a gamble that paid off. I'm 5"0 and the adult crutches work just fine for me! (I thought I'd need youth size!)
customer_reviews.author: M. P.

customer_reviews.title: It was these or a wheelchair
customer_reviews.text: These have definitely helped my mobility. Both of my knees are so damaged from arthritis that I can't extend them anymore and walking is extremely painful. Both knees need to be replaced. It was either get these or a wheelchair. So far these are working. I am able to do a little more than I could before I got them. They definitely help me to stand up straighter and help ease the pain of moving around.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: High Quality & Comfort
customer_reviews.text: Broke my tibia and was looking for better comfort than the standard issue underarm crutches provided by the ER. These are amazing! High quality and comfort. I’m 55 yr old and have no problem using these. Of course you need arm and shoulder strength as this is what you use for support and movement. Very easy to use and very solid, secure movement possible. Highly recommend. Don’t spend more money if you’re just looking for recovery from an injury.
customer_reviews.author: E,James

customer_reviews.title: PLEASE DO NOT BUY THESE!! YOU WILL FURTHER INJURE YOUR SELF!!
customer_reviews.text: These are the worst crutches you could even consider to purchase, do your self a favor and pay the few extra buck for a better pair!! Less then 2 months and the cuffs need to be replace,on of the cuffs stretched out as I was going up stairs and I ended up falling down the stairs and have seriously hurt my self, PLEASE DO NOT BUY THESE!!
customer_reviews.author: Joey Zee

customer_reviews.title: to a great recovery from a hip joint replacement
customer_reviews.text: These crutches are a HUGE improvement over the standard cane! Mine (I only need one) is helping me use less pain killers (pills), and is teaching my recovering leg to be much more independent. At age 88 I am well on track, now, to a great recovery from a hip joint replacement. I gave the 2nd crutch to a neighbor who also had a hip joint replacement, but who is having a difficult recovery. Amazingly low price and is solidly built.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin K. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Huge cuffs, hard handgrips, but good once modified.
customer_reviews.text: Great crutches, I use one or both depending on pain levels and joint stability for chronic illness. I highly recommend these to anyone looking to switch from other mobility aids. They help take the pressure off the wrists during use, much better than my cane or underarm crutches. I took a star off for two reasons: One, the handgrips are very hard, I used a heat gun to heat them up and pull them off, and bought new, soft handgrips at the local drugstore. Two, the forearm cuffs are HUGE. Luckily, the curved "lip" in the front allowed me to push them closed and tie them tightly together with paracord. Now they don't fall off my arms.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Almost worthless; save your time and look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: Yes, they're cheap; alas, they're also worthless. As noted by other reviewers, the cuffs are way too big to fit any normal human forearm (Popeye's arms would slide out of these cuffs!) and NOT adjustable. This fatal flaw makes the crutches nearly worthless -- having the cuffs hang on your arm when you release the grip and lift your arm is a key feature of forearm crutches. I'm puzzled about how they could craft something so essential so wrong? In any case, these are going back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Fil Y.

customer_reviews.title: Overall they’re pretty good and comfortable (though you will want some padding ...
customer_reviews.text: Overall they’re pretty good and comfortable (though you will want some padding on the handles if you’ll be using them for too long), but as a 5’1 adult who bought the youth size, the length between the cuff and the handle is still just a bit too long for my comfort on the shortest setting (though not so much I can’t use it), and the cuff is so huge it would constantly off my arm. I’m big enough it’s not a huge deal and I was able to alter things so they worked, but if you’re buying them for an actual child who isn’t practically adult sized it may not work so well.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Large forearm cuffs make this product useless
customer_reviews.text: If I could give zero stars, I would. The forearm cuffs on these crutches are too large. They make the crutches very unsteady, do not stay on the forearm and completely defeat the purpose of forearm crutches. I attempted to modify the cuffs by using a vice to squeeze them in order to narrow the cuff for a tighter fit. The metal in the cuff bent and eventually broke after short usage. Replacement cuffs are more expensive than cost of these crutches brand new. Absolutely useless and a frustrating experience.
customer_reviews.author: jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable boundaries
customer_reviews.text: -Good balance -Good grip -Forearm grip is very big around the arm, but is adjustable to flip either side- I keep my forearm grip at a 40 degree angle to where my arm is almost resting on the grip as I crutch. -Adjustable heights -Pointing at people who walks too close Win- Win
customer_reviews.author: Shelbie Wright

customer_reviews.title: If you need them all the time, you should invest in padding.
customer_reviews.text: I love that they're light, easily stored, and easily adjusted. I don't like the smell that comes off the rubber and onto my hands. If they were smart, they'd use a different "non-smelly" material for the hand grips and/or provide covers.
customer_reviews.author: Rayster

customer_reviews.title: ACL knee surgery
customer_reviews.text: I am a heavier woman, and I am tall. Just had ACL surgery and these have been far more helpful and dynamic than the armpit crutches. I am staying with friends so I feel more reluctant to ask for help getting up and sitting down. These are sturdy enough to hold me up. They show a max weight of 250lbs, I am right about there and I feel good! The arm parts are really wide, I used rubber bands to tighten them and they've been great since! Highly recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: T and H

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable height, Unadjustable cuff
customer_reviews.text: The angle of the crutch is a little too steep for me personally, but it is otherwise stable, sturdy, and pretty light weight (which says a lot, coming from me). The cuff is unadjutable, and cannot be fitted to people with smaller arms. (The cuff side opening should be large enough to get your arm out without struggle, but also small enough that the crutch won’t just fall if you have to open a door or hold something for a moment) Overall, they’ve been impossibly useful and have made me way more mobile around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Zmcr1234

customer_reviews.title: Did not last long at all
customer_reviews.text: I am disabled and rely on crutches for my daily life, these however did not even last 3 months before the cuff screw came off and broke. I do not even know if these are covered under warranty but anyways I would not recommend these at all.
customer_reviews.author: Y

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic crutches, no more bruised armpits or sore shoulders.
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking for a pair of sturdy comfortable crutches for a while, tried the normal armpit destroyers, these have made my life so much better they are light weight but seriously sturdy and they don’t make irritating clicking sounds that most crutches and canes tend to make, and the have plenty of adjustment in both the lower and upper sections.
customer_reviews.author: J&R

customer_reviews.title: Why spend $400 on Forearm crutches?
customer_reviews.text: My Physical therapist suggested I pick up some Forearm crutches. The brand she had were close to $400. Yeah, can't afford that. I found these and wow!! Best value by far!! The forearm clamps wiggle a little.. buy hey I'm a big boy!! I would say my only real complaint was the plastic dip on the clamps smell, just give it a good wash with soap and water.. Problem solved!!
customer_reviews.author: B. Steele

customer_reviews.title: very helpful
customer_reviews.text: I have osteoarthritis in my right knee and I use 1 to help for support. I bought some soft handle wraps which make them more comfortable. the only thing I have a problem with is the part that fits on your arm is sticky and with winter time it's hard to get it on if you have on a bulky coat.
customer_reviews.author: amazoncrazy

customer_reviews.title: It's better then a Cane.
customer_reviews.text: Was as expected for a Low Price. Is Light Weight being Aluminum. I recommend you get this instead of a basic walking Cane, as Canes can cause Pain in you Wrist & Hand. The upper Arm Cuff gives your hands a little bit less pressure. Not sure how long this will last ? I only got this encase of a future Foot Emergency if Foot tissue suddenly Ripped. Depends what your diagnosis is, but this is better then a Cane.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Danforth

customer_reviews.title: Ordered Two, Received One
customer_reviews.text: The picture clearly shows a pair of crutches. We received our shipment today, and there was only one crutch in the package. Amazon, it looks like a really terrific forearm crutch if only we had received two as pictured and not just one.
customer_reviews.author: lovemybeagle

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and well-made
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a similar pair of forearm crutches for the past six years. While this new pair resembles the old, I can already tell that they are better made. It's such a relief to have a new, strong pair of crutches with better tips. I was starting to become afraid with my old ones that they'd fall apart and I would suffer an injury.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Hesson

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I'm a fairly big guy and they seem to be good and sturdy to me. Handles are a little big around. I don't use them like regular crutches though. More like supporting,balancing, and resting because of knee and back problems. I don't put all of my weight on them like regular crutches would be.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Both crutches came apart and basically failed their intended, both times causing a fall, LUCKILY not serious injury resulted.
customer_reviews.text: My son with cerebral palsy uses one crutch to aid his walking. I gave him the new crutches for Christmas. During the month of January one of the two screws, holding the arm piece to the crutch fell out causing him to loose his balance and fall. I assumed it was one off and did not feel the need to send a note. Last week the same thing happened to the other crutch again causing a fall. Because of my experience listed above I wanted to write a complaint. Please acknowledge receipt of this note and any thoughts you may have regarding the matter described above.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Cavanaugh

customer_reviews.title: More than pleased for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and sturdy, handles are a little uncomfortable but I’m 250lbs. At 6”3’ you wouldn’t want to be any taller but at their max height they’re just great. I’ll get some pads for the handles so to save yourself a couple of days of discomfort suggest you buy some handle pads to go with these.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Smith

customer_reviews.title: Medline Forearm crutches
customer_reviews.text: I was born with Spina Bifida and have walked on crutches all my life. These crutches are great for the price. The only problem I have had with them is I slipped and when I did the cuff opened up and now I can't get it to close so that the opening isn't bigger than my forearm. I have tried squeezing it shut and holding it there for a while to get it to stay closed more but it just opens right back up. So now whenever I try to do something with the crutch on my arm it falls off into the floor and I have to bend over to pick it up.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Vazquez

customer_reviews.title: Good for this short guy
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 60-something man, 5'2", stocky with very short legs. I fell and turned my ankle recently and needed something for a few days that would take more weight than just a cane. These crutches were fine for that purpose, easily adjustable, and handily took my 200+ pound weight. Used both for 2 days, and just one for another 2 until I was able to walk on my own again. I'll be keeping these around for my next tumble.
customer_reviews.author: V. Way

customer_reviews.title: The quality is generally good with one exception
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for a few weeks. The quality is generally good with one exception. The tips can slip when it's wet, and that's a big problem here in the Seattle area. Of course 1 slip that leads to a fall can be a disaster. They are otherwise rugged, but I'm looking for something else that has a better tip if that's available anywhere. It may be that all manufacturers use the same tip.
customer_reviews.author: Richard J. Adler

customer_reviews.title: Quality at an Affordable Price
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot a research about the different kinds of crutches there are and decided on forearm crutches. I used these for about a month and a half. They take a little practice, as I'm sure all do, but these were very sturdy and made my life a lot easier after having ankle surgery.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Great crutches!
customer_reviews.text: These are a nice pair, is a different brand from what I'm used to but they're so quiet, I love it. I give it four stars because the forearm part is too big for me and it made me lose my balance a few times. I changed the parts with my previous crutches, and now they are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: johailyn garcia little

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: We lost our crutches of 20 years during a trip and this product came just two days after we returned from the trip and ordered from online. We were very impressed with the fast delivery and very happy to be able to walk with crutches again. These crutches are light weighted, sturdy and stable, are better than the older ones. The price is also very reasonable. We are very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Corrin L.

customer_reviews.title: Cuffs not stiff enough.  These won’t last
customer_reviews.text: I am an amputee and have been using crutches for 10 years. The cuffs on these crutches aren’t sturdy. They need to be stiffer.
customer_reviews.author: David R. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and dependable
customer_reviews.text: I use these when I experience severe back pain because of limited ability to use canes or regular crutches due to injured shoulder. These are not as light as I wanted them to be, but they are very sturdy and dependable when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Tony H.

customer_reviews.title: Great crutches.
customer_reviews.text: These helped me through a knee injury they’re great for the price I’m super thankful for these crutches they make everything a bit easier now I’m starting to walk a bit again and they help for support still.
customer_reviews.author: Sin

customer_reviews.title: wholeheartedly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Impressed that crutches are strong and sturdy while being light weight and supportive simultaneously. I weigh 115 lbs. And was safe while being easy to manuever. I have dropped them from shoulfwr hieght without dents or damage.
customer_reviews.author: M. M. Truehart

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Just received this yesterday and right out of the box I was impressed....used the Next Day shipment, for $8 it was a bargain. I have to be on crutches for next couple of weeks and hated the ones I had use, these are lightweight and allows much better movement to get around. For a MIC product I have to say so far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: thomas l nolen

customer_reviews.title: OK...But, cuffs are way too wide and flimsy/bendy for adults who need stability at the cuff...
customer_reviews.text: They do the job so far, but the cuffs are too wide and flimsy/bendy for adults who need stability at the cuffs to aid in balance issues. I have pretty big forearms, so that should tell you something...but, they are usable...so far. Have had them a couple weeks. Usually have to get new crutches about every 2 years. Will see how long these last. Hope they'll last that long, but skeptical about the cuffs.
customer_reviews.author: terryc316

customer_reviews.title: Fore arm crutches work well when you have iv picc line on upper arm.
customer_reviews.text: We have regular crutches. Could not use them because of iv picc line placement on upper arm. The fore arm crutches work very well.
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and convenient
customer_reviews.text: SO much better than underarm crutches. I’ve been using them for 1 1/2 months now (broken femur) and haven’t looked back
customer_reviews.author: A. Ainslie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I hurt my knee and back. I'm short and crutches are painful. These forearm crutches are perfect! They are well built, sturdy and lightweight. Easy to use and adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Boopy

customer_reviews.title: Strong and well built for a tall person
customer_reviews.text: These are strong and work well to help me walk upright, as opposed to a rolling walker, which is not tall enough for a six-foot person. Deducted one star because these crutches would be perfect if the rubber tips were a bit larger and if the handles had slight indentations to fit and hold fingers in place.
customer_reviews.author: Lyn

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid, perhaps too much so.
customer_reviews.text: As usual, arrived well packed, in good shape. Solidly built. Very solid. I used a couple of Carex folding canes prior to this, very lightweight. These are far heavier, much thicker aluminum. Overkill? Nice adjustments, and (surprise) decent instructions. My PT suggested forearm crutches and told me how to set them. The Medline instructions matched what she said. They are a bit hard to stuff in the car next to the seat, but good around the house. The handles are not the most comfortable, I'm looking into rubber or foam sleeves. For the price, hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: T. Conrad

customer_reviews.title: low quality
customer_reviews.text: i try to return it because of low quality . useless this item . i am totally ignore amazon right now because lot of item is low and low quality .... ebay is batter then amazon for quality , quantity .. everything
customer_reviews.author: ASM Kamrul Islam

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Petite Girl
customer_reviews.text: These are so much better than regular crutches. I’m 5’1 and 100lbs, they worked perfect for me because they didn’t cause underarm discomfort. I have to admit, I did have to put a sock over the plastic elbow holder because my skin is sensitive and rashes easily if rubbed against for too long. OVERALL GREAT PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Landeros

customer_reviews.title: a bit disappointed as the arm cuff where way too big and ...
customer_reviews.text: a bit disappointed as the arm cuff where way too big and arm would come out of the cuff. Husband had to use a clamp to squeeze them together so could wire them to use by a petite lady. Plus a bit too tall and lowered them to short as can be and guess we are going to try & figure out how to make them 2'' shorter. otherwise, they work as should. Only 4'7'' so guess should have tried to find child's
customer_reviews.author: jb

customer_reviews.title: Needed Support
customer_reviews.text: I bought these prior to having hip replacement surgery as my mobility was severely restricted and I was in great pain. The crutches are sturdy and I liked them much more than under the arm crutches. they are also easy to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Pohaku

customer_reviews.title: nice crutches, only complaint is the steel forearms will ...
customer_reviews.text: nice crutches, only complaint is the steel forearms will not compress small enough to fit a small boned women's forearm, the other forearm crutches I bought previous for my daughter fit perfectly, but this set was for the daughter-in-law, needed a set due to foot surgery.
customer_reviews.author: fargo20

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I had to have ACL surgery and my husband recommended these over traditional crutches. He was right (hope he doesn’t read this. 😂). These are much more convenient because you can still use your hands. They worked well for my need.
customer_reviews.author: Anderson

customer_reviews.title: They’re perfect and beautiful.
customer_reviews.text: They're great, i had a pair for years and i recently lost one. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: PlW

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: Great assistance for walking. Adjustments make the perfect length for both arm length and height. Lots of complaints about the forearm clamp being too large, but is perfect for me. Yeah, I'm an extra large person, take that into account.
customer_reviews.author: Elay Oftedahl

customer_reviews.title: Hard handles and peeling plastic.
customer_reviews.text: Fine forearm crutches. Nothing mechanically wrong with them. Three stars because the rubber coating started peeling off the forearm holders in about 3 weeks. Also, the handles are very hard plastic. This is fine for a couple weeks of crutching around but after a month on them and at least another month to go I would have opted for something with more cushion as my hands are rather sore by the end of the day.
customer_reviews.author: J. Piotrowski

customer_reviews.title: Forearm crutches
customer_reviews.text: I like these crutches but i wish they had two more rivits in arm band for more stability. Wish i could send back
customer_reviews.author: Gifford

customer_reviews.title: Great for learning to walk again!
customer_reviews.text: Great! Only giving a 4 star because the forearm sleeve guard on mine tore pretty easily so there's now a rip in it. Great to use learning to walk again after bunion surgery.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and a good buy. They work great.
customer_reviews.text: I'm rather large and I really beat these crutches up and they really work great. They last and last. You might need to replace the rubber tips from time to time, but that's normal. YOU MUST get padding for the part that goes around your arm (you can find crutch pads on line - google them $9). The arm grips will hurt if you do not get these but this is true of MOST ALL crutches. It's what you need to address. These crutches will last forever for me.
customer_reviews.author: b. Dillon doyle

customer_reviews.title: Forearm size not for child
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these child crutches for my child. Unfortunately, the forearm isn't for a child. It's more so for an adult, the size is too big and there's no room for adjusting it to make it smaller. For the price, I guess it's the risk you take.
customer_reviews.author: Dels G.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, sturdy, and easy to sdjust
customer_reviews.text: Use these for my patients as an alternative to wide based quad canes. Any Physical Therapists out there, try these for your outpatient CVA patients instead of the hemi or quad canes. See the freedom it gives them and more safe than the other devices.
customer_reviews.author: Eric C. Christe

customer_reviews.title: I am now free to move about
customer_reviews.text: Love these, they work just great. My only peeve is that they squeak, but I remedied that by coating the squeaky parts with graphite as a dry lubricant so that it didn't collect dust and hair. I have advanced peripheral neuropathy, a nerve condition, so walking is a pain. The cane I used just doesn't cut it anymore, I needed support on both sides, so I puchased these and can move around swiftly instead of slow.
customer_reviews.author: Lycantis

customer_reviews.title: Stability for the Unstable.
customer_reviews.text: My husband uses them . He is a paraplegic and with braces on his legs and the crutches he can walk short distances.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Foster

customer_reviews.title: Simple, sturdy, lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, lightweight, no frills. Great when forearm crutches are required for use in a potentially dirty environment.
customer_reviews.author: JCJ

customer_reviews.title: Price
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these per a recommendation from my physician. And for being a great price you get a product that is easy to use. And steady. The only down fall is they aren't as light as I wish they could be and the arm cuffs need a softer liner. But there great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Khela Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Great deal! Huge help walking!
customer_reviews.text: Foot surgery with light walking- these worked perfectly for stability and they are quite sturdy! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.  Could use padded handles.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, very good quality. Much easier to transport than regular crutches. Could use padding on the handles. After a while my wrists get sore.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Jarchow

customer_reviews.title: They did the job.
customer_reviews.text: They served their need and was comfortable to use. Far better than the regular crutches I received from the doctor. Still holding up well and can maneuver around much better. Was a bit pricey but worth it in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: J.B.

customer_reviews.title: Dissatisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: These are heavy, to big for my upper arm and have no padding on hand grips. Dissatisfied but holding on to them because I trip whennusing a cane. Use regular crutches right now
customer_reviews.author: Lois Woods

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing and come with a great price tag. My husband is a large person and these are just what he needs to help him be more mobile.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: These crutches worked well. Adjustability was more than adequate. Used them for four weeks so they were durable enough for my needs. Only minor issue was that the locking rings would come loose every other day. Admittedly, I wasn't gentle on them.
customer_reviews.author: Heatherlun Uphold

customer_reviews.title: Prefect Crutches
customer_reviews.text: These are prefect for use. no one should ever use the other under the arm pits again. I have used these for 60+ years and they will help you walk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: cuffs are NOT adjustable
customer_reviews.text: The cuffs are NOT adjustable! Useless for my wife now I have to return them. Company admits they don't make an adjustable cuff. My forearms are 4" across and they're too big even for me.
customer_reviews.author: B1g Bleu

customer_reviews.title: More freedom
customer_reviews.text: Gives me more stability and mobility for my bad lower back and hips
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Romero

customer_reviews.title: would recommend these
customer_reviews.text: A real help when my hips or knees go bad. Hand grips are hard, but not terribly. It adjusts easily and does the job- good product. May have to paint mine a neutral color, the wasps like the shiny steel surface.
customer_reviews.author: nonyer bizness

customer_reviews.title: Mobility returns
customer_reviews.text: Good product for the price. Makes my walking easy again
customer_reviews.author: michael r lung

customer_reviews.title: Last and last. Adjustable arm bands.
customer_reviews.text: Have used these same kind for thirty years and have replaced this one time. Enough said.
customer_reviews.author: marguerite allred-crawford

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: I had been useing the Forearm Crutches at the Therapist & just had to have a pair.....Yours turned out a lot better than the ones at the Therapist..... I am 100% satisfied with them & very highly recommend them......
customer_reviews.author: thomas Marshall..

customer_reviews.title: Highly recomennded
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight but very sturdy. Gives me mobility when I can't use a wheelchair
customer_reviews.author: Janet Doubledee

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, adjustable for adults
customer_reviews.text: Adjustable on the upper arm portion and the legs. Not for kids as the upper arm portion adjusts at the smallest for an adult.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I returned this item was not what I expected and not comfortable for me to use
customer_reviews.author: Louisa88

customer_reviews.title: This product is as advertised and helps my mobility with less pain.
customer_reviews.text: Product was as described. This product allows me to be mobile again. I have bad feet and have trouble getting around
customer_reviews.author: Suzer

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: As advertised. Cuffs are a little large but used large rubber bands to keep them on when bending elbow.
customer_reviews.author: samlawson

customer_reviews.title: New crutches for home use
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought these for me. They are light weight which is good, but the rounded hand grip can hurt your palm after a while.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Spence

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: product delivered on time and is what I need and expected. light weight and good quality .
customer_reviews.author: Pballman

customer_reviews.title: Great Crutches but need hand grip padding
customer_reviews.text: Love these crutches. So much better than the under shoulder ones. One and only complaint is the grips beat up your hands. I would only recommend this product if you get padded grips. I had ankle reconstructive surgery and was only taking the pain pills for my hands, not my ankle. Must get the crutch accessory padded grips
customer_reviews.author: Tim L

customer_reviews.title: Makes noises, arm cuffs way too big
customer_reviews.text: They make noises when walking. Arm cuffs are too big for stability, I added rubber bands but that comes with its own issues
customer_reviews.author: Savannah

customer_reviews.title: I broke my sole, this crutches help my commute ...
customer_reviews.text: I broke my sole, this crutches help my commute much faster than before. I use my hands, elbows, waist, the heel part and another healthy foot. Spread my weight and reduce the burden. Reduction of fatigue.
customer_reviews.author: kazue

customer_reviews.title: Exactly like advertised, if you need them timely order 2 day shipping.
customer_reviews.text: Had a small issue with a piece of black plastic being jammed inside one so it was impossible to adjust, but I pulled it out finally and now it works great. If your hands don't work incredibly well than you will need assistance getting them to the right height. Otherwise it handles perfectly. I have them so that I can finally start walking after a bad spinal injury. They work perfectly for me.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Gardenhire

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Great other than one crutch’s arm part was too loose.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: This style of crutch is not for everyone, but if you like this style, these are excellent quality. The grips are a bit hard on the hands, especially if you need to keep most of your weight off of one leg.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Guy

customer_reviews.title: I didn't feel like they were stable without a snug fit with the ...
customer_reviews.text: These work, but I returned them. You get what you pay for, right? These crutches are cheap, and they heavy and the cuffs aren't adjustable. I didn't feel like they were stable without a snug fit with the cuffs and just didn't feel comfortable moving around. They are relatively well built. Strong, adjustable, etc. but I need something that has cuffs that fit and is lighter
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I would be lost without these. Bought because I was traveling and needed an extra set. Better than the first set I bought.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: My husband is very pleased with them
customer_reviews.text: Really impressed with the quality, especially for the price. My husband is very pleased with them; just what he needed.
customer_reviews.author: FluffyRAM

customer_reviews.title: Great crutches!
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my mom when she broke a metatarsal in her foot. She hated regular crutches and they hurt her underarms so I got her these. She was so much more mobile and they are easier to tote around in the car. And they are way cheaper than the ones you get at the hospital!
customer_reviews.author: Kierra Laverty

customer_reviews.title: work great, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: So much easier to manipulate than under arm type crutches. Not used regularly...periodically have knee/joint problems. Very handy.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn DumondTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Good solid product
customer_reviews.text: Works great, I wish it had a means to affix a Velcro strap or clip.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Hopkins Sr

customer_reviews.title: Not worth buying and not worth even 1 star
customer_reviews.text: My husband needed these after surgery for a leg amputation. Within the first 3 weeks the covers on the bottoms were worn thru so we bought replacements and the following week the arm pads are breaking away. Very disappointed with this product!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Solid pair of crutches. Had used these for 6 weeks, Handles were rock solid (which hurt my hands). But I survived those 6 weeks with these crutches, I just put some towels on the handles for extra cushion. It was easy to maneuver around places and obstacles with these crutches.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Medline one week old crutches broke while my daughter was ...
customer_reviews.text: Medline one week old crutches broke while my daughter was in the subway in New York. Leaving her helpless. If it wasn't for two people assisting her who knows what would of happened. Junk
customer_reviews.author: peter

customer_reviews.title: they were a lot better than the armpit killers
customer_reviews.text: they were a lot better than the armpit killers, you have to be fairly coordinated and mildly athletic to use them but they helped me get through a really bad time with a blown out knee
customer_reviews.author: chance brown

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice!
customer_reviews.text: I needed to have new crutches. I was unsure because the cost was less than half price of all the others. I took a chance. They are excellent value, excellent and immediately ready to use. I wish the upper handles, the one that goes around the top of the arm, were able to be smooshed together to be tighter...but that is my ONLY complaint! GOOD CHOICE1
customer_reviews.author: A. Harris

customer_reviews.title: Not a good item if you depend on crutches all the time
customer_reviews.text: These crutches are not durable. I have only been using them about a month and they already don't feel sturdy. The Guardian Forearm crutches usually last me about two years. I have already ordered another pair. I'll use these as a spare in case I am in between ordering the better quality crutches.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durability
customer_reviews.text: In less than a month the rubber overwrap on the arm cuffs has started to separate and the protective cap on the top of the crutch fell out and was lost within the first day. I'm curious if replacement parts are available.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal
customer_reviews.text: I just received my crutches yesterday. I was skeptical of the quality of them at such a low price. I'm very happy with them. They are comprable to the pair I'm using now, which I paid much more for. Mine get a lot of use (and abuse). I can't walk without them due to a chronic progressive disease, so I need good quality. My current ones have been through a lot, and these make perfect replacements.
customer_reviews.author: Nabisco

customer_reviews.title: The Medline Forearm Crutches are very good. In fact I can use one and feel ...
customer_reviews.text: The Medline Forearm Crutches are very good. In fact I can use one and feel comfortable. stable and much faster.
customer_reviews.author: Loch Louman

product_meta.title: Medline MDS805161 Aluminum Forearm Crutches, Adult, Pack of 2
product_meta.description: Size:AdultRecommended for long-term disability, these crutches are built rough for long-lasting performance yet boast features that provide welcome benefits for you as a consumer. Non-skid rubber tips provide good traction.
feature_bullets: Telescoping parts are manufactured with internal bushings and external lock nuts to provide totally silent usage
Black components hide signs of wear and scratches;Height Range: 5 - 6'2(Inches)
Tall Adult has a 250-lb. weight capacity, Patient height, 5'10"-6'6"; Adult has a 250-lb. weight capacity, Patient height, 5'0"-6'2"; Youth has a 250-lb. weight capacity, Patient height, 4'2"-5'2"

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
